TL;DR It's a very long story, but this company doesn't care about its players at all.  The long story: I purchased a founder's pack to Tree of Savior and was there the moment the doors opened (after having stayed up all night to secure a desired team name due to them not being prepared to launch their game on time). While more games are managing to launch without any issues, it is still relatively expected that there will be some kinds of hiccups at launch (although I expected this to be less likely since they've already launched the title in South Korea).   Due to even more issues at the moment of launch, I could not log in to the server my friends wanted to be on (Klaipeda). However, I could log in to a server called Orsha. At the time, the FAQ on their main site mentioned that team names would be unique to each server. I figured I could go ahead and grab my desired team name on Orsha since Klaipeda didn't seem to be online at the moment. I grabbed my desired team name on Orsha and soon found out that their FAQ was not accurate; They had changed team names to be unique to each region. They also changed the official FAQ a week later (after the early access launch) to reflect their new changes.   I have sent in six tickets asking what can be done to get my team name from Orsha to Klaipeda. The first ticket was automatically closed without a response. The second ticket was given an autoresponse that did not at all answer my question. With the third ticket I was a bit rough with the customer support and basically said 'You are wasting both my time and your time by giving an unrelated response rather than trying to work through the issue'. I then asked if it was possible to do a server transfer for the team since they had said they would allow a one time free server transfer for all founder accounts. The customer support answered and said it was not possible at this time to do server transfers. I waited a long time to file a fourth ticket; The ticket was filed when the EU servers opened up and they were allowing transfers from Klaipeda and Orsha to the new EU servers (but were not allowing Klaipeda to transfer to Orsha or vice versa). I did not receive a human response to this ticket; however, I was given an auto-response saying:   'Q. Why is my ticket still 'Unanswered'? A. The transfer tickets will be answered after the transfer process is complete.'  I received this response on the night before the server transfers happened. I had filed the ticket on 4/15/2016 and the auto-response was given on 4/25/2016. I was excited that it appeared that they had manually transferred my team during the maintenance, but upon attempting to log in I found that my team was still on Orsha. So this is when I sent in the fifth ticket.  I asked, once again, if I could please transfer to a different server. They replied:   'We understand that you want to transfer to a different server. Unfortunately, we regret to inform you that all request for server transfer has ended. We are no longer accepting request for Server Transfer. For future news and announcements regarding server transfer, kindly visit our official website'   For my sixth 'ticket', I sent a private message to a CM politely asking what my options are (even if that option is to hang tight for another ___amount of time___). I expressed that I simply desired to join my friends on Klaipeda with my Orsha team name. (I have not made a character and I have not redeemed any of the founder's pack items). I sent this private message on April 27th, and the CM did not bother responding to the message. The 'free server transfer' that was advertised with any founders pack has been amended to apply only to server transfers IMC wants to do. Originally, there seemingly weren't any constraints on which server they would allow the free transfer to apply to. Now, it seems they will only allow you to go from Orsha or Klaipeda to the EU servers, or the SA server.   I'm not necessarily upset about their lack of ability to do something that at the moment they just can't do. I'm upset about how they've been flaking me off for well over a month without giving me any answers as to what can or can't be done. In my ticket responses they've made me feel like I'm the one entirely responsible for my predicament when they're the ones that had an incorrect FAQ entry on something as important as team names at the moment of launch. If anything, it is a shared blame, but they have done NOTHING in an attempt to cooperate with me and fix the situation.
I will wait untill F2P on April 28th. Sorry for my misunderstanding, I just didn't read it well.

Where to start?  Positive Game is pretty, if you like the animu style it's right up your alley, gorgeous drawn environments, abilities generally look pretty good as well.  Lots of classes, really interesting as well and a good diversity of classes and abilities, sadly the game doesn't tell you much about them or what they do, so it's almost hard to put this in the plus column. And there is no respeccing, so if you mess up, better reroll.  My friend plays it, no really my friend likes it, that's the main reason I play this game.  Negatives  Well the community on the games forums are completely horrible people, so don't bother going there for help when you need to find out the information about the game which should be included in the game but is not. Not only that but they take pride in the fact that their game tells you literally nothing about how abilities work, or actively tells you the wrong thing. They see nothing wrong with the game telling you an ability does one thing, but it does another, or Nothing at all.  Stats are pretty meaningless, they don't matter much at all. abilities scale so poorly with stats it's humorous, you'll have maybe 300 in a stat if you dump most of your points in it by the time you hit the cap, most abilities will do X + stat damage or so, of course in the later levels X is usually about 3-4 thousand. so your 300 in your stat is about 10% scaling. Not very useful, dump points in either DEX for crit, spirit for mana, or con for HP.  There continue to be huge problems with optimization, control, and server stability.  The 'translation' is actually a fan translation, no literally the company made their text available and said hey translate this for free. They didn't bother to hire a professional localization team, and it shows, it really shows.  The information transparency is TERRIBLE, just plain awful, You can't really learn what abilities do, there is some nebulous stat called 'aoe factor' which does something to do with AOE, it looks like it should increase the size of your AOEs, but going from 2 to 7 did literally nothing to my abilities/circles. Not to mention that it is a completely useless statistic that is 100% arbitrary and has no comparison to what people already know. Incredibly poor design.  You cannot join a guild until the end of the game, and only if you are the correct class to make a guild, yes making a guild is a class decision, so I hope you didn't want to be the other class at that tier.  The cash shop is the worst kind of garbage I've ever seen. It's beyond even pay to win ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, it's pay for features that should just be part of the damn game. Combined with Draconian lockdown on gold sellers which of course haven't stopped gold sellers at all but have screwed all the regular players. 30 trades a month, IF you buy a subscription. 5 auctions if you bought a sub. It's ridiculous.  There is no respeccing, if a class doesn't play the way you thought it would, better respec. This is fine if it's a tier 1 class or w/e but if it's a tier 5 class that's like a week of playtime right down the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Of course you only have the most vague of ideas of how a class will play because of the complete lack of information or help you will receive. The response from the community is 'just reroll it's fine' ♥♥♥♥ that, seriously. I don't mind rerolling if I want to try something new, or I had a cool idea, but rerolling because the game is garabage at conveying information that should be conveyed is just not acceptable. I'm not even asking for respecs, I just want some idea of what to expect. (if I have to look something up on a wiki about the basics of the game, then the game has failed.)  Overall this game is pretty, it wants to be ragnarok online, but holy ♥♥♥♥ is it just a completely half ♥♥♥♥♥ attempt to gouge you for 10-50 bucks.

Tree of Savior :   This game is not Ragnarok Online. With this statement out of the way, the rest of the review.  + Beautiful graphics and style. + Diverse classes. + New IP. Not a reboot or continuation. + Characters can jump on things and up buildings.  - Combat system is what it is. You will like or dislike it.  x Cannot trade without the use of pay-tokens. At the time of this review, one is capped to 30 token-enabled trades a month. x If not using a pay-token, Market/Auction place only allows one item up at a time. 30% tax on sold item. x Linear progression.  x No open world. Exploring is done through quest markers- not your own free will.  ______ I was greatly looking forward to Tree of Savior for years. Disappointed to see that the game became a linear coaster. Even more disappointed seeing that player to player trade, one of the most fundamental features of a MMO, has been required the use of pay tokens. The reasoning is that this will deter bots from entering the game. Black Desert Online EU-server has done this, and their worldchat is still flooded with advertisers. Surprise, surprise, look what is happening. Surely, in all their infinite wisdom, there must be some smart programmer out there who can create a way to identify and neutralize these botters without infringing a necessary human component of a social experience? Oh wait, creating a system like that would cost money. Why spend that?  I still feel this game has a lot of fun for players, but cannot recommend ToS for executing this emerging, bad industry practice. Price was not a concern for me-- if the game was monthly-sub or buy-to-play, no complaints. If MMO features are going to be removed, why keep it a MMO? Why not just make it a co-op game with focus? The simple answer is, 'Will not make as much money as Nexon Cashshop MMO'.   I'm confident the game will do well and find its audience. Numbers will be fantastic when F2P launches. No crashing and burning like other AAA disasters. The playing community's culture will grow with the game and create wonderful artwork. To all who play, especially the younger players; I hope you have as much fun with this as my friends and I did with RO. Put your smile into the game and make it the best game on the internet.

Game at it's current state is barely playable.  - there are game-breaking bugs present at every turn - server latency is worse than you'd expect from an indie game running out of somebody's garage - at least half the content is either disabled or unplayable - there is literally no balance in either PvE or PvP (with the latter being non-existant except for guild wars) - several game mechanics introduced mke the experience even more unpleasant then it needs to be - there is literally no endgame to speak of  If you are looking for a game that will allow you to create a character and solo through 280 levels of killing monsters and occasionally clicking on an NPC to pick up a quest then this is the game for you. If you are expecting social interactions, a free market, balanced content, finished content, WORKING content or even PLAYABLE content - this is not the game for you.  I'm not saying you can't get several hundred hours worth of playtime out of this - you can - I am a good example of that. However you will find that it amounts to nothing in the end. The more you progress the more you notice that the game makes no effort to keep you playing, but rather just teases you to start and then says 'oh well, you got me, I got nothing'.  Not to be called out on empty words let me give you JUST A FEW examples of what you might expect later on:  - for those familiar with RO (Ragnarok Online, which this game tries to be but fails on all accounts by the way) you will remember that gear was enhanced with cards to add interesting ways of grinding monsters or make fun builds. In this game the concept is copied using 'monster gems' that add 1 skillpoint to a skill. That's it, there no variety or special effects to that. Most importantly those gems cannot be traded and as such you are forced to look for a 0.01% drop for yourself each time you need one. And yes they do drop off monsters that are as rare as a decent MMO.  - If you played any MMO you will be familiar with the concept of an Auction House / Market that allows you to sell items to other players. In this game however the developers decided they know better than you , and as such you are not allowed to set a price above or below what their algorithm picks up from the game. As such, given the fact of bots, RMTs and simply people not knowing the worth of items in the beginning you are now unable to sell most items simply because nobody will pay the set price and you are not allowed to sell for less.  - Recently the game has been moved from the Eastern US to several servers across the world. I can only speak for the server I play(ed) on, which is the EU one (located in Germany), but the latency varies between 20 and 800ms. (yes 800!). This issue is omnipresent and does not in any way limit itself to people with poor internet connections or located in specific places. It is also not at all dependant on the server's current capacity, since you will get a ping of 20 at midday and a ping of 600 at 3am seemingly at random. Latency changes (spikes/drops) can cover a variance of +-300 over a span of 20 seconds. It's a true rollercoaster ride of lag.  - Game mechanics itself is beyond unfinished. With several ways to control your character (mouse, keyboard, mouse + keyboard, pad) depending on the class you choose to play you will end up with a multitude of issues. Skills will not register, skills will lock your character in place, switching weapon will lock up the game for several seconds, latency changes will make you rubberjump all over the place. Most keys on the keyboard can be used to bind skills, but only a handful will work properly. Attempting to bind most skills to keys on the right side of the keyboard will render them unusable or make them trigger once/10tries if used in combination with the movement arrows (does not depend on your keyboard, just on the way the game handles I/O requests).  - Optimization and stable FPS are things that will not be found here, even by the likes of Sherlock Holmes. Simply turning on the map can drop your FPS to 5 for several seconds. Turning on the map AND trying to run or attack will plummet the FPS to a grinding halt almost always. At this moment over 90% of the players are using the lowest available settings and the developers have since added several options to disable most of the graphics 'fanfare' you might have seen in the videos - it did not help a lot. The game still uses a single core regardless of the CPU you might have and will (while still laughing at me with 30fps) force my Intel i5 to encounter temperatures that it has never experienced before. After several hours in the game (even if only at the login screen) your PC will be ready to serve as an oven/hearth for all your culinary desires.  I could go on, but honestly, try it out for free and leave as soon as you can. Do not spend money on this heap of camel dung. Don't get swayed by the first 100 levels that look and feel almost fun - check all the issues I've described above , and if they all pan out just know they are only about 5% of it.  1/10 would not get scammed into founding again.

I'm giving this game a positive review, because all in all, it is a great game that has just been launched and I believe it can improve a lot more. Even though this is a positive review, I'll concentrate in giving my opinion about what's bad in the game and what needs improvement.  I think if an MMO is to succeed for many years, leveling and gaining experience needs to be extremely hard. It should be almost impossible to reach the maximum level, so that the game could be more competitive and people wouldn't get bored of it, if everyone reaches the maximum level, then what's the point? So far, from what I've seen, it's way too easy to level up and gain experience.  The game suffers from bad lagging, it's very annoying, even with a fast internet speed such as 100mbps which I am using, the game lags way too much. It's so annoying to be running through a map, and return to the same place over and over again because of the lag and server connection. Also when killing mobs this happens, and for several seconds it's unresponsive until it finally responds and it's too late and you're dead, especially when you're killing bosses.  24 hour maintenance seems like a little exagerated, no matter how much transfers they have to make, at least this was their excuse, 24 hours should never happen. Even though, I believe that if great work and improvements are being done during this time, then it's worth the wait, but if they keep making such long periods of maintenance with no major improvements, then this is a no no.  Finally, this is the point that annoys me the most... We are playing an MMO, with stunning environment and story rich, so what's with the electronic dance music? Seriously?!? NO ONE wants to play this game and listen to dance music... A game such as this should have classical mystical background music... I don't know who's behind the music scene on TOS, but seriously, you have NO IDEA what you're doing. This is definitely the point that, to me, is more important. This kind of game needs a great soundtrack, definitely NOT electronic music and most definitely NOT dance music... Even the almost 10 year old Flyff has a much better soundtrack than TOS.  This is it, apart from these negative points, I have to say that TOS is very promising, and with work and effort from it's creators, will be here to stay for a few years to come.

I really enjoy the core mechanics of this game but it's honestly being choked by lacking some very basic MMO features. This is caused by either cash shop nonsense, futile attempts at stopping bots, or a combination of both.  There is no trading. Not unless you use a token, which costs around $20 and only applies for 30 days. And even then, you have a finite amount of trades, and they only work with OTHER TOKEN USERS. And they DAMAGE THE ITEM'S POTENTIAL, meaning you can only trade it so many times without it being DESTROYED.  This means I, a DPS swordsman, am stuck with 3 staves in my inventory (because the loot sorting is random), while my mage friend has two scimitars. Both of which would be upgrades for the right class. But since we don't want to pony up extra money, those items are functionally useless unless you want to attempt a pseudo-trade on the market.  This is meant to stop gold traders and their bots, but the game is nonetheless full of them. You can't go into town, even on Orsha (the less populated server), without three alts standing there spamming links to a gold selling site at any given time.  THERE IS ALSO NO TRADING BETWEEN YOUR OWN CHARACTERS UNLESS YOU BUY THE $20 TOKEN. And it acts as if you're trading with another person: only allows you to trade ONE SLOT at a time (log on.. log off.. log on.. log off..), takes away from your trade limit, and ALSO DAMAGES THE ITEM'S POTENTIAL. And 'untradeable' items such as realmoney hairstyles are not tradeable between characters, as far as I know. Which means if you want to delete a character but have something valuable yet untradeable on it... you're out of luck, aren't you?  But honestly my biggest qualm isn't even the trading. It's the fact that skill resets cost realmoney and stat resets aren't even possible ingame without the $50 founder's pack (in which case you get One. Just the one). There are a TON of classes and skills and some of them are COMPLETELY USELESS right now. You chose one on accident, or just thought it sounded cool? Hope you like paying money to fix the mistake, or remaking your entire character.  Considering level cap is over 200 and this is a grindy mmo, as well as the fact that skills are constantly going to be being rebalanced, that is completely unreasonable. It is super easy to screw up your character permanently with no recourse. Skill resets only give your skillpoints back, too, they don't undo your class changes - once you swerve into Barbarian, there's no going back without remaking. I'm totally fine with skill resets costing money... but for god's sake, make it INGAME MONEY. This is a basic feature. I should not have to pay real money if a skill that defines my build gets nerfed.  A game with class diversity as a highlight should include the ability to reset and freely play with all of the different options, rather than expecting a player to carefully plot out a build beforehand and hope to god they don't get nerfed, don't you think?  The graphics are gorgeous, the game plays well and a lot of the combat is genuinely satisfying. And the class system is a really interesting concept. The staff has proven they're willing to work with the community to fix the problems, even if they're a little slow about it. But I would recommend waiting until it goes f2p at the end of the month. I can't tell anyone to spend money on this game when it has this many dealbreakers that are really simple, reasonable things to expect in an MMORPG.  We shouldn't be punished for really simple things like 'picking the wrong skill' or 'wanting to trade an item to my other character' and forced to pay money for them.

All in all while the start has been rocky i love this game and the developers are always listening to us for ways to improve it. so please give it a try. if you don't wanna pay just wait for the free to play but i truly feel you will enjoy this game ^^

TL;DR = I do not CURRENTLY recommend you to play this game. Its current state is not worth it.   =If you came here for the diverse class system... --stay away!! Think you can choose any job you like and still think its viable at any point in the game? wrong! Skills dont have enough synergy with one another. You need to have the right jobs to be effective or even just functional late game! Defeating the purpose of having a diverse class system... so sad.  =If you came here for the story and quests.... --again, STAY AWAY!! Too linear, too boring and most of the time, doesnt make sense.  =If you came here for the community.... --do I still have to tell you? The forum consist mainly of White Knights, Intellectuals who are wasting their brain power arguing with people who cant and dont understand them, Trolls, Whiners, and Attack dogs whos only purpose is to attack you personally regardless of the topic. A very toxic community. In-game, is a bit different, mostly nice people, wolf in sheeps clothing i guess.   =If you came here thinking you can just solo your quests forever.... --Early levels... yeah you can... mid... maybe... late game? NO! Kirito-kun is a myth! This game boasts its party system... which is useless early game. There isnt even a main quest that recommend you to party-up.   =If you came here for the dungeons and the bosses.. --Have you paid attention? Dungeon. Its basically, clear mobs, kill boss, get loot. Strategy not required. Except maybe for luring mobs. Same goes for world bosses.   =If you came here to play as a swordsman.... --Rethink. Or change class.. the weakest class tree is the swordsman tree. Later in the game, your skills become... weak. So weak no one ever wants you... unless of course you have a certain skill or youre a tank. Trust me, please. You dont wanna be wasting time leveling, building and in the end feel useless. Also, unless youre a monster riding swordsman, mobility is your basic problem when it gets to PVP.  =If you came here for the PvP.... --Its SO balanced! Physical damage can be blocked, dodged, or can miss. Magic damage doesn't miss but it also doesn't crit. Magic damage has magic amplification basically adding damage to your magical damage. But of course theres element resistance and magic defense, surely you can increase that to counter. Yes you can, wear CLOTH, low pdef, high mdef. Or have insane resistance to all SPECIFIC element damage. Or use all your skill points raising the SPR stat which basically only gives you SP, SP regen, block penetration and magic defense, sacrificing damage and HP just to counter magic. Not to mention the lack of CC, and mobility for swordsman tree. Seems balanced to me :)  =If you came here to be a rich man.... --You cannot be a rich man unless you can have what paying players have... a TOKEN. But even with that, it wont stop the market system's roof and floor pricing. But of course. selling and trading items are not the only mechanics to get rich. theres also selling services right? Gem roasting, repairs.. and the likes... they have taxes and most of the just seems OVERPRICED...  ---------------------------- I dont even wanna start with the technical issuse this game is suffering..  IMC's decision making is... Questionable. Most of the time, YOU get punished while theyre trying to work around things THEY should have been expecting already.

I would not reccomend this game. I've put a lot of time into it, and every day I find something new to be disapointed at and another to be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off about. There is a lot to enjoy in the game but it is just not worth it for me. First off the game is flat out unfinished.   Most of the core 'stuff' is there but text will be poorly translated, vauge, confusing and flat out formated so that it is unreadable. Want to know how long your upgrade will be? Fat luck, its hidden behind another text box. Currious what your monster kill stats are? Well... its readable but the infomation is all overlaping eachother. Oh what was that item you just picked up? Oh, no you cant see that, you just finished a quest objective and that alert box is taking up your screen for the next 2 seconds no matter what you press.  Most of the systems in the game are bare bones with no quality of life features or feedback. The marketplace is useless, you can put up one item at a time unless you are paying money and you can not even search for anything. Want some cloth armor? Too bad, you cant search for it unless you know exactly what the name of the item you want is. How about browsing the gems that are available? Nope, there are too many search results and you get an error message. What about that Magic Amplification property you wanted? Alas, that is not even a search feature. Then lets just try to buy this thing and click the buy button, wait what happened? Nothing? Lets try again... still no feedback, lets try one more time, CONGRATS NOW YOU HAVE BOUGHT AN ITEM PLEASE CHECK THAT THE FEATURE ACTUALLY WORKED (Paraphrasing).  Then if you try to leave the map you have to stand in a specific zone but again there is no feedback, is it the ever present lag causing me to not warp or am I not standing on the right pixle? Oh, and I had to run by that doorway to get to the blacksmith but now I'm warping, I didn't want that to happen!  *sigh*  The lag is ever present, if you have a full party your frame rate will tank (on a freaking PS2 quality graphics game) and your sound will chug no matter what your settup. Even if you are not in a party your game will periodicaly freeze for half a second, and if you want to open your map it may freeze your game for up to 5. Its incredibly frustrating to have a combo-oriented class that has 1-2 second windows of oportunity to deal large ammounts of damage but any little lag hiccup ruins it.   Just don't bother, I'm uninstalling the game tonight.

TL:DR at bottom This is a review from someone who has not played the majority of the game and is still in the process of levelling, so if you're looking for some details for endgame content you might want to skip this review.  Review: The game brings an odd mist of nostalgia from Maple Story where you had to pre plan your build in order to min max and had to spend tons of time grinding but yet the grind is done in a way where it doesn't feel tedious.  The class system is where the game tries to draw in its players, there are a large variety of builds created by mixing classes together so you can enjoy a play style you like however that is also a big downfall, if you specifically wanted to play a druid you would have to trudge through grinding a cleric to level 170ish just to see if you like the spells, this can cause a lot of detraction from the game as people don't want to spend 100's of hours to become the class they want. Having said that in my opinion the classes are all different enough that I can enjoy the experience of levelling just about any of them.  The combat is simply fun, I don't know what it is about it but it just feels great to fight the enemies. Once again it's kinda like a Diablo styled combat version of Maple Story.  You always feel like your progressing because your always levelling up and working towards getting to your next class or circle, rather than the end game being where the fun starts the fun is levelling.  There is a mostly cosmetic premium shop, the 'token' however does give some small benefits such as more move speed and trades but can be purchased from the auction house for the standard game currency.  The OST is amazing, bosses especially have epic tracks which almost make it sad if they die too quickly as I would gladly listen to their theme all day.  The art style is one which could live like that forever its not limited by the engine it is exactly how the devs wanted it, cheerful but not distracting.  The game seems to have quite linear levelling options, all level brackets only seem to have 2 choices for maps which you can grind or quest in depending on your starting city.  As with all MMO's there are a lot of gold spammers and bots however the devs do seem to be actually working on resolving this unlike some games. (Blade and Soul)  Due to how you acquire stats / skill points which can't be reset unless you make a new character (Skills can currently be reset through premium currency) it is not an entirely noob friendly game, I had a friend who was levelling a mage and put quite a few points into Dex because he thought dodge would be more useful to him.  You can't level yourself down to help lower level characters and if you're more than 20 levels out of range of someone experience earned is halved, I understand this is to stop power levelling and such but it's annoying if you have to have a main character and a character for when friends are on due to work etc.  Rant: I dislike having to post a review, however this game is getting a lot of unworthy negative feedback regarding the 'F2P' aspect as of the moment, People don't seem to realise that you are paying to get into a beta version of the game and you are getting a month's head start along with relative premium currency. You could alternatively just wait until the 28th where the game will be free to play for all.  PROS: Classes. Combat. OST. Art. progression.  CONS: Finding a class you want to level. Not entirely noob friendly. No levelling down to play with friends. Choices of areas to level in.

I really hate to do this, since this game has a fantastic class system, a beautiful (and nostalgic!) design, and more levels than I can shake a stick at... but I think I'm done. Here's why. (TL;DR? It's IMCGames, the host!)  1) BOTS BOTS BOTS BOTS BOTS. About 3 bots to every player I see. The towns are full of gold sellers. They're everywhere, and even the Korean servers have them. The developer either doesn't care, or does not have the ability to deal with them. Also, they teleport, and some aoe attack whole zones at a time and silver scoop.  2) Game-breaking exploits. Namely, a form of currency that can be refunded/cancelled before steam catches it leading to a mass-hoarde of cash shop items that are illegitimately obtained and in the hands of... you guessed it... flat out fraud tier-BRs.  3) Restrictions are placed to combat bots that are (obviously) 100% ineffective, and damaging to players as a whole. Add in the other locked features, bonuses... and the end result is this game is NOT free to play.  4) Things seem to actively be getting worse, not better. Simple fixes are not implemented: too many to even list. Pets covering NPCs, no way to kick players out of dungeons or find more from inside, a party matching system that is 100% random, ignores class and level, and does not guarantee a viable party... etc.  5) There is no real communication about any of this at all. Even basic information about future plans is inconsistent, at best.   It's this bad... and supposedly the game is ready to release? You kidding me? This is just awful. I could be a more viable gaming company as a one-man show hosting this out of my garage.

RATING: 8/10  I absolutely love this game. One thing people trying to decide wether or not to play it need to know is that most of the hate is not aimed at the game, but at the bugs plaguing it and some quality of life choices that are easily changed (and, in my opinion, WILL be changed due to the community outcry and the way IMC has repeatedly shown that they're willing to listen).  CONS - The game is very buggy. I've escaped most of it due to being on the EU server, but I've had problems like not being able to log in until after a few tried, the game freezing during a dungeon (and losing me a daily run)/when someone tries to enter my lobby, etc. Nothing that makes it unplayable, but you WILL encounter bugs as it stands - Trading: you can't trade unless you buy a Token, and even then only 30 times. I have one but I don't know how I feel about this - The Market: you can only put up 1 item as a free user and 5 as a VIP, but this seriously screws with the economy because it's not worth putting cheaper items on the TH. I don't see how any crafting classes could earn money  Now, onto the...  PROS + The game is actually FUN. As in, if I was playing it, I would enjoy it in the same way I enjoy gameboy releases of Zelda or Secret of Mana... and that means everything for me. + A lot of great ideas have been implemented, like bonuses from collections, varied secret quests with great rewards, prizes from adventuring achievements (incl 100% map completion), chests hidden in random places, etc... it's GREAT  I won't make this any longer but the fun factor just makes the whole game worthwhile. I'd play it even if it was offline. So this gets a thumbs up from me.

Played for almost 100 hours. Mainly at (SEA)Varena a bit at (SEA) Telsiai  Good game, good potential, not yet perfect.  Pro: - Nice Graphic - Nice Story - New Class System - There are hidden quests - IMC does try to do things just don't answer people questions much (Valve?)  Cons - Overprice DLC (No way to topup TP just yet) - Game Engine is not optimize, roughly 20-40 fps even on high end pc - No good PvP system (class balace) - Laggy at peak hours (double on weekend)  Although there is many flaws, I still really like this game I do enjoy playing it and discusse which npc is the best waifu on world chat. The class system shine at PvE as weird combination keep coming out, STR priest FTW. This game really remind me of good ol RO, at least on my opinion, much better then the RO2.

Bots and gold-sellers populate the server, and PVP needs some heavy balancing since control spells/skills are too powerful. PVE, however, is a fun grind. Mindless quests on field maps, XP rewards for exploring maps, high-spawn dungeon maps, instanced party dungeons - all these are enjoyable, considering the many builds available in the game.  It's a fun MMORPG as it stands, especially if you like the aesthetic.

Tree of Savior is a really great game with a lot of serious (but ultimately fixable) flaws. I'm just gonna do some bullet points on it quick.   - The gameplay is fun and addictive and if you like action RPGs at all you will probably have a blast with it. It sort of harkens back to games like Secret of Mana, Legend of Mana, and Seiken Densetsu 3. And, of course, Ragnarok Online. My only gameplay-related complaints are that it's really really unforgiving when it comes to your character's build so it's easy to make mistakes that will haunt you later on, and also that around level 30-35 and again around 70-75 it's easy to get lost and confused and lose track of what you're doing.    - The artwork and the game world is beautiful and colorful. The characters are well-animated. The portraiture is just awesome. The skill and spell effects are pretty cool. There is some flickering going on with things like fog and lighting and foreground objects (pillars, trees, and so on), and there are some clipping issues with the character's hair while jumping, but overall the game is really kind of gorgeous and I'm sad that I don't see more art like this in modern gaming.    - The game's music is super milquetoast and there are a limited amount of sound channels so sometimes when there's a lot going on sounds can sort of abruptly cut off and it's kinda messy.    - It's one of the most poorly optimized games I've ever seen in my life. I have an i5 4460 CPU and a GTX 960 video card (not impressive, but not terrible) and Tree of Savior chugs like crazy in towns and in maps with a lot of people. I'm talking 5-10 frames per second, here.   - The game is plagued by an ever-increasing number of bots and RMT spammers. There are literally dozens of bots camping out in popular farming zones using hacks to attack enemies at long range with melee weapons. It's a growing problem, but IMC seems to be aware of it, at least. They've taken a few steps in the right direction WRT the chat-spammers, so let's hope they keep moving in that direction.  - On the other hand, IMC has also taken a bunch of ABSURD measures to combat botting and RMT that are entirely ineffective and ultimately cumbersome to legitimate players. Trading is restricted to premium accounts and players cannot trade money. The auction house takes a 30% (!) cut of any money you earn from sales, ON TOP OF the normal posting fee. When you sell something on the auction house, you are forced to wait a full 48 hours until you can retrieve your money. AND you cannot trade items between your own characters (although they recently posted about this and might be changing it). Unfortunately there's no right click > report function in the game, which kinda boggles my mind a little since it's a pretty standard feature in modern mmos.   - There aren't many hairstyles or costumes in the cash shop yet, so after level 90 people all basically look the same.   - In stark contrast to the beautiful artwork, the game's story and dialogue looks as though the localization team just ran the korean script through google translate and cleaned it up a little. It's bad. It's really bad, and I hope they fix that someday.  - There's a non-optional profanity filter in TOS and it's the worst and most invasive/annoying I've ever encountered. It checks words, it checks parts of words, and if you have a flagged word or syllable in your message, the entire message is deleted. Words like class, encumbrance, titan, etc are flagged because they contain '♥♥♥', '♥♥♥', and '♥♥♥', respectively.  - People in the game aren't very social, and on the NA servers there are a lot of non-english speakers. Which isn't a bad thing necessarily, but it can make it hard to make friends with anyone or find a group.   - Even now, before the official F2P release, the game's cash shop has some pay to win items in it. Enchanting scrolls allow players to enchant their cosmetic head items, and the stats on the enchantments (despite what the game's die-hard fans would have you believe), can be quite significant. Enchanting can add 20-40 attack power or magic potency to a hair ribbon, which is the equivalent of dumping 17-34 levels worth of stat points into your strength or intelligence. To put it a different way, 40 attack power or magic potency is around 15% of the stat on an endgame item. It's a severe advantage that you can only buy with money, and it has to go.  In spite of all this crap, I still love the game. I have almost 100 hours in it already as of the time I wrote this review, and I'm still having fun. So I totally recommend it, but I do want to stress that it is a flawed game. I am hopeful for the future, though!   See you in...uh...whatever this game's world is called (I've skipped most of the dialogue since the opening scene).

Tree of Savior is an Isometric(kind of?) Action MMORPG that looks a lot like Ragnarok Online but that's where the similarities end. I'm not going to go into too much detail in this short review but I've put enough time into the closed betas and the 'finished' release to say that I can honestly not reccommend it. It will hook you for a while but after some time the flaws about how unfinished & unbalanced it is stick out and you will begin to question if the game is/was worth the time sink once you hit mid-game.   Right now 70-80% of the classes are not viable in the late game with no way to respec your classes other than make a new character, monster spawn rates are abysmal and you have to contend with bots (which there seems to be less of now so I'll give IMC some credit for that), IMC's methods of dealing with botters & gold sellers also restricts legitimate players too much, frame rates can be horrible even if you have a rig way above the min/rec specs, the player to player market place pricing is a freaking mess. IMC being slow and incompetent when it comes to updates & fixes with very little interaction with the community, the game still feels like it's in beta. I could go on and on and on.  The things I liked about it was the music and the graphics. Very nice animations & artwork and some environments were very beautiful (the jungles, anyone?). I like that IMC finally added a report button to combat botters & gold sellers however it took 3 weeks to implement it. Why it wasn't there to begin with is beyond me. Same can be said about them fixing loot distribution for groups.  Anyways, the game needs A LOT of work to win me back.

One of the most exciting games i played this year, finaly a reason for me to play an mmo that isn't Maplestory or WoW.  other mmo's usually get boring after or during the tutorial where they fail to get you excited from the ground up start and every moment after that. This game learns the lesson by using fun combat that is satisfying, and starts where you have already gained your powers (example wizard already has a staff and does magic) and doesn't ruin the flow of the game like most new 3d mmo's do. I like this games camera and graphics, really nice art style. Optimization needs some work, frame stuttering issues near alot of people which is weird since theres nothing graphically demanding compared to something like a battlefield 4 match with more than the same number of people.  overall i find this game alot more fun to play alone, in a lonely channel. but if you do want to find allies you'll definitely find.  Rewards from are a bit different this time, instead of getting exp, you get a scroll that gives you a specific amount of exp whenever you wish to use it, this is unique because it lets you grind and save an specific number of exp scrolls untill you want to spend them on a level that you're really having trouble on.  Controls are great, everything feels just right.  Music is alright, nothing you've never heard before, but it does fit the flow of the game and is nice listening to. I was a bit dissapointed of the graphical options, i wish i could change resolution in fullscreen, or change rendering settings, how about low-medium-high-ultra and not just few checkboxes to select that are pretty much ultra-settings of the graphics. Another thing i have to point out is the controller support, finally a way to use the controller in an mmo without slow downs and stopping in combat. This might be surprising but i actually prefer to use my logitech 360 styled controller for this game, it's very fun.  to sum it up   PROS: *Eye candy - beautiful graphics , nice style. *Gameplay - Satisfying combat, fast and fluent, platformish with some beat em' up, if you do like the style of maplestory, *and dislike the slow combat of most mmos' , you'll definitely like this one , and this one even more because it's not *button mash 1 skill to grind, variation does matter and is satisfying. *Quests are fast and fun to do. *Music - i guess i just listened to everything that this just doesn't excite me anymore, but it is good. *Controls *10/10 Controller support in an MMO *A spirtual 3D successor to pre big-bang Maplestory & Ragnarok Online  CONS : *Optimization issues *Not many graphical options, like rendering % settings or resolution on fullscreen, it's 2016 and every game should have that *Long loading times on some areas, distrupts flow of gameplay

Well to be honest despite the faults the game has I still like it alot. The class system is interesting and the art is great! I am a free user and not premium. I can understand that this game is not for everyone, but as a f2p game I think you should give it a try.   To clear something up that I've read alot in other reviews: - Trade and market restrictions: the first few days I suffered from those as a free player. But I can do both now, it is an account restriction against bots: your ToS acc/character must excist for 3 days before you can trade/use market!   With every equipment you trade ingame 1:1 without tokens (premium) it will lose 1 potential. Potential is what you need when enhancing items, when it hits 0 potential it will break. The item will also lose 1 potential if purchased through the market.  If you sell something on the market it will take 48h before you get the silver and you have to pay 30% of the profit as commission fee and you also have to pay to get the item on the market. Premiums pay 10% commission and have more market slots to sell stuff.  - You can't trade silver 1:1! The only way to gain silver is grinding and selling items to NPC or on market.  Now for recommendations for people that want to try the game out: - Search for a good guide for the class you would like to play and if you want to go PvE/PvP/hybrid. There is no STAT reset currently in the game and the skill reset will cost you 88 TP (TP can only be purchased with real money, 100 TP is around 10 USD but don't kill me if I'm wrong). - I heard Klaipeda is the better starting city.  And some things that are still broken in this game: - FPS drops/freeze. Like, often and it has nothing to do with your computer/laptop.  - There are some bugged quests at least in the early levels. It could be that you're underleveld and get the main quest back after leveling up but there are still some weird bugs in it. - Marketplace with its set prices is messed up; very common herbs on sale for ridiculous prices. Silver sellers are most likely to blame for this. - I haven't played PvP yet so I can't say anything about it. I do like the PvE, though it can be grindy and the respawn rate is too low in crowded maps/channels. - I'm still quite a low level at this stage (level 65 rank 3 wizard, max level cap currently is 280 with 7 ranks) so I can't say anything about endgame.

Before you begin reading note that most people here tested the game before it was even avaible for public, currently it's f2p and most bugs and issues have been fixed and no lag seems to affect the servers anymore, so forget about that, it's all good now, botters are also gone, Ave maria.  Cons: 1. The way I see it what matters is the experience itself and not the game's features, if you're looking for a good time with your friends, this might not be as fun as Ragnarok, and by that I mean, you don't get to stick to your friends, the questline will push you further and further into more missions rather than make you grind mobs in a group, eventually you will find yourself teleporting from map to map to complete your missions and so on, so forget about team work unless you're running a guild which is incredibly expensive or dungeons that you only get to do past level 50 twice a day.  2. If you like to play by the market and go full merchant shekelstein, go ahead, but not without premium, so forget your profit because you won't get any with a 30% tax and no currency trading or whatsoever, you can only trade items and with premium you get a 10% taxation on the market, which is still a great rip off in your profits, IMC crippled us good here.  3. Another problem you might find is leveling up, not that it's hard but you'll have a hard time figuring out when to use your exp cards and knowing what maps you should clear first, also, you must clear all maps and do all quests otherwise you stagnate late game and get stuck with no cards and no missions, you mustn't do them too late nor too early, otherwise you'll have hard time grinding less than 1% exp mobs, worst case scenario your equipment gets trashed and you are left broke with no money and no conditions to come back.  4. Unfortunately, aesthethical customization is an issue, you don't have many options besides your hair which you don't even get to choose the color, you'll have to grind mobs to get different colors, and hats are mostly either expensive and hard/impossible to get or they're so common everyone has them, very limited in my opinion, a waste for such a well detailed game. No visual diversity at all.  Pros: 1. Great characters, great animations and the music is simply amazing, it won't make your head ache and it synchronizes damn well with the map themes, the graphics are awesome and certainly drew most of the game base by it's aesthethic sense 10/10 for drawing efforts.  2. After the updates there is no lag and mostly no bugs, not sure if they fixed all classes but it's all good as far as I've gone through, the players in the brazilian server are quite friendly and will help you out, and most certainly will need your help in return sooner or later, goldsellers are unable to profit due to no silver trade and steam currency packs are now selected by server and will probably have different prices, so no more exploiting, no need to ♥♥♥♥ everyone equally like before, IMC disposes of a bad decision making team shame on them, but it's fixed for now, I hope.  3. The game simply offers you many features and builds, you'll find yourself immersed in your class, be it a full highlander glasscannon or a supporting hybrid tank heretic gypsie druid, althought some classes are useless as far as I'm concerned, you can ♥♥♥♥ up your character easily so don't go around doing stupid ♥♥♥♥ pretending to know what you're doing.  4. Just go and see for yourself, it's grindy but fun, everything about it is well done and the gameplay feels really great, the PvP is pretty fun too, the game is one of a kind, go check it out!

EDIT: 08/08/16. Please ignore all the negative crybaby reviews from people who are hurt that the game isn't perfect. A lot of children play this game because it's easy to learn. Complaining about beta bugs, and crying about spammers (even games like WoW still have them) don't warrant or justify a negative review. You have to look at the fact that this game IS good enough to get MANY people to play for over ONE THOUSAND hours. If it truly IS a bad game, people wouldn't play it for so long. So please take these salty tantrum reviews with a huge serving of extra salt.  --------------------------------------------------  I spent almost 150 hours playing the CBT and OBT of Tree of Savior and I can say that it is an amazing game that isn't remotely without its flaws or issues. However the most important thing is that it is fun, unique and a refreshing change from all of the MMOs that are mass produced these days. In addition to this the publisher (IMC) have moved mountains to try and accomodate players from various walks of life and parts of the world.  Since the Head Start was announced IMC had added not just an EU server to accomodate EU players in having low pings, but they have even realeased an SEA server for players from South East Asia. These are 2 choices that no one really expected them to do even after we campaigned so hard for more servers, so it was a fantastic and positive surprise for us all. Furthermore they even compensated players for the downtime at launch with many premium items.  Honestly no matter what way you look at it or what game you come from, the publisher (IMC) has been trying really hard to uphold a higher standard of customer satisfaction. I can only give them the utmost praise for this.    A few quick postitive things about the game:

Pros: -Class variety, lots of permutations! -Gameplay can be as complex as juggling 20+ skills or casting 3¬5 spells and holding the z button to auto attack.  -Sprites!  -Music thats fitting and not there to annoy you -High lv cap 250+   Cons: -hardly a story(go find some dude so he can make you find another dude) npcs are forgettable -Boring linear maps ( imagine the snake line in DBZ ) -PvP is just a 5v5 brawl -Hollow premise, Grind to a level so you can grind more with NO END GAME. -Sciencing=potentially expensive Pay $9 to Reset skills, Pay $9 to Reset Stats  Token section(read: SUBSCRIPTION) -  You need a @Token@ which is like a subscription to be able to trade with other players   -  Auction house tax rate is 30% by default if you dont have the subscription

Had high hopes for this game. The major issues are:  - Extremely buggy. This game was in beta for about a year(maybe more?) and still has tons of game breaking issues such as unclickable NPCs and objects that are neccessary to progress the game, an error that at best keeps you from entering dungeons, at worst switching areas that can kick you out and lock your character out of the game for several hours, and many more that you're guaranteed to bump into if you give this game an hour.  - Average to severe lag on a regular basis. Self explainatory, lag can make or break a game. If anyone knows what the term 'rubber banding' is- when you walk forward, you will be teleported backwards several times until the lag spike(something that is quite frequent in this game) ends. This makes any kind of movement in a major boss battle IMPOSSIBLE, as you will take every hit regardless where you move on the screen.   - God spammers. Although they're really in every game, this game has a global chat that is endlessly spammed by so many different accounts that blocking them is futile. Also, when the spam is especially bad, it can lock up your game. Hasn't crashed yet.

Okay, time for a review.  Likes: It is very much like playing classic RO. The advancement to a new tier of class is indeed much like playing RO. The map doesn't rotate but you are still able to see your character at all times unlike RO where you can hide your character behind something and have to rotate the map to find them. The skills in this game are simplified compared to RO where each class can have roughly 10 or more skills to use on top of each tiers skill set of possible another 10 or more. In this game you are given 4 skills each tier. This is one of the few games for the PC which has a decent joystick control. To activate each level of skills is just a trigger or tab button plus your gamepad buttons away from executing.   Dislikes: The maps are wonderful in their illustrations but I feel to much is going on. While my laptop isn't the greatest, dropping from 20+ fps down to 0 in towns is just to much. Having to run to pick up an item that drops from a mob is tedious at times when the coins they drop come flying at you on their own. Not having an option to change the graphics from high to low is a bit weird. There are things you can turn off but it's not the same as a graphic scaler.  Overall, I feel this game is nice but somethings need to be improved. Would I recomend this to a friend? Yes, because it is an enjoyable game.

The game is great fun, but gimped so hard by restrictions that claim to be to combat RMT and gold spam, but all that's happening is it's hurting the player base.  No trading for F2P or if you do pay you get a whole 30 trades per month. PER MONTH. This is ridiculous. I would not reccomend this game based on the following reasons:  1. It's very buggy - some areas you can't access without it bugging out. 2. Lag - the game's FPS behaves strangely a lot of the time no matter how powerful your rig is. I've heard confliciting things about this issue from various people. For some it's fine but for others it's not. With regards to myself, I've experienced quite bad lag from time to time. E.g it'll go from 20 fps to 54 fps to 30 fps etc etc.  3. No trade feature - I was partying with my brother and there was no way for him to trade a weapon fit for me.  4. Incredibly linear - if you were expecting a comfy game with some nice exploration then I'd give this game a miss.  5. Music - pretty subjective but I expected the music to be better.  Something I did like about the game is the combat and the amount of classes though. If you're willing to put up with a few cons and you don't mind linear games then this might be for you. Otherwise I wouldn't bother getting too invested.

I played this during one of the betas a few months ago. Maybe I'm just too old and jaded for nostalgic video games now, but I didn't really enjoy it. I made it to about level 100 (which admittedly isn't very far in this game) and all I ever did was get shuffled around from area to area doing quests, then stop and do an instance for a couple of days to load up on exp from that. It got boring VERY quickly. The instances are fun at first, as they don't really use the 'trinity' system from normal MMOs. You can go with the standard tank/healer/3dps setup or you could have 5 dps classes and as long as one or two of them has a few ranks in a heal skill normally your party would be okay.  There isn't really much point to player interaction outside of instances which is kind of sad as this is supposed to be a multiplayer game. Most MMOs seem to be going down this road though.  The class selection is vast and I think that will be the draw to this game for a lot of people. There are I think 50+ classes and HUNDREDS of combinations you can go with as each class is a 'tier' and as you climb the ladder so to speak to the upper tiers you can take any class you want. If a class is really good you can choose to take that class again to make its abilities better and even get access to new abilities in some cases. There are classes even focused on non-combat stuff such as potion makers, scroll sellers (you can take any ability you have and sell a single use of it to other players, really useful for buffs and stuff) and even a class that can repair gear and give out buffs with a meal table wherever you are in the world. This is probably the high point of the game. There is so much variety between players that even if two people are the same class they could be completely different due to taking a completely different path to get to that class.  In closing this game will probably be a lot of fun for people but it definatly isn't for me. Wouldn't reccomend unless you're into min-maxing, or creating the perfect character in a game with a ton of choice.

Update: I received a response to my latest ticket submission and Email one week after submission. The Bearkaras Fragment was restored to my inventory and I have started to play the game again.  Though there are remaining issues with the game as detailed by others in their reviews, I now feel comfortable recommending this game.   Original review fiollows:  I purchased the Founders Server: Exclusive Access 1 DLC and played the game to reach around level 80. The game is enjoyable for the most part but seems to have some major design flaws. I have stopped playing the game due to one of these flaws.  The major problems I experienced with the game are:  1. Support: I could not find a way to contact a GM or open a trouble ticket in game. I had to go to the website to submit a ticket. To submit a ticket or post on the forum, you have to login with a Facebook or Google+ account. Your Google+ user name is displayed in the forum post it you login using your Google+ account. I was able to receive a response when submitting a problem report via Email but it appears TOS support has ceased all Email responses.  2. Boss Item Drops: Many of the bosses can only be fought a single time and they provide a unique drop when defeated. Many of these unique item drops are necessary for recipes to create items critical to character progression. This is all well and good until, as in my case, one of these unique items fails to drop when a boss is defeated. My problem is that the Bearkaras Fragment was not received when I defeated Bearkaras (I defeated this boss around level 80). I am not able to craft the Zachariel Bangle which effectively results in my character status being 15 levels below normal. I consider the lack of the Zachariel Bangle such a detriment that the game is not worth playing any longer.   3. Inability to resolve issues: When I discovered I was missing the Bearkaras Fragment, I opened a support ticket. I did receive an answer that the information was being forwarded to the developers to prevent occurrences of a similar problem in the future. I did not receive any indication that the missing item would be restored in my inventory so a followed up with a forum post in the Game Bugs area asking if I could expect the missing item restored or the quest reset. I have not received a response to my forum post to date. I finally wrote an Email to the TOS support that included a copy of the forum post and ticket text. I also included screenshots to show I defeated the boss but didn't have the fragment in my inventory. I have not received a response to this Email.  I consider the game unplayable without the Zachariel Bangle and am disappointed as I was hoping to play the game at higher levels. I believe I have done my utmost to resolve the issue but have not received the appropriate response from TOS support.  I cannot at this time recommend the game due to the problems I've encountered. I will update this post if this situation changes.

This game is easy to play, suitable for players that like to play with others (that’s an MMO after all) and for those that like to play alone or just with one or two friends (like me). The class system is… big. I have no other word. It is very flexible, suitable for any kind of player. Except maybe the tank type. I really miss the tank type, but TOS is most focused in damage (even for the cleric classes), so making a full HP warrior is not recommendable. Really, I tried.  So, about the music, the aesthetics and landscapes, I have nothing bad to say. They are beautiful. It is like playing a better Ragnarok Online, the same thing as many people think by now.  No mentions about the story, what is easy and maybe a little plain. Quests are easy to understand, so you have no problems to start gaining exp.  There are some little bugs, however, that must be fixed, and some decisions that are a little… odd. Like the censure. What the hell? I’m not a native English, so my vocabulary may have “words” censored without any reason… IMC MUST fix that, because it’s so hard and tiring to TALK with your party.  There are other things that I hope IMC will change and improve (no trade of silver, 48h of delay when sell in the market, the incredible market fee…). But anyway, the game is good and it’s still in development, so I recommend it.  Oh, and I must say this: for the people that say that this game SUX because it is full of bots and spammers and killstealers… is it the game fault, or it is yours for no reporting? Think about it.

ToS just doesn't capture what I loved so much about Ragnarok Online.  What made RO great for me? The openess of the world and the freedom to build gear sets for specific dungeons. And why was that desireable? Because the economy thrived on rare drops found only from specific mobs in specific places. Being able to gear towards +wind elemental damage and +damage to fish and water type monsters would allow you to farm Bib so much faster and efficiently than those who had genereic gear. Collecting drops which had a 1 in 10,000 chance became much more freequent when you had approreate gear - which in turn allowed you to finance more gear sets and higher upgrades on your armor.  I didn't catch any of that in ToS. Maybe there is more of that towards the end game but if there is; why do you have to play through so much of the world just to get there? None of the world seemed reusable in ToS. Once you out-leveled a zone, there didn't seem to ever be a reason to go back.   The way ToS has designed their class pathing, gear, item drops and player economy just seems more restrictive and more generic than RO. I'd have to even say their '80 different' classes is a bit of an overstatement. So many of the classes you only take for one tier as it serves as nothing more than a stepping stone to get to the higher classes.

This game is beautiful! Something that I really have expecting for years! SOOOO much classes and levels!! You can choose your skill and status points and other things that you don't see in nowadays mmos. It is an old and new mmorpg at the same time. But the game is recent, first week of early access, and because of it, it has a lot of problems, like some bugs. And they are trying to control bots and gold sellers with 'not popular' ways, like limiting trading. But I really think that in time and with the support of those who believe in the game, it will become a big, fun and beautiful game, where the journey until you reach the last level will be so important as the endgame. In my opinion, it is really difficult to find a good game, but this is REALLY a good game, that it is still incomplete. It is free to play, but for getting the most of the game you surely will have to pay, not because it is pay to win, but the mechanics of the game is limited for those who don't pay it. I personally don't mind, because most of the good game are pay to play, like WoW or FFXIV. So it is like they let you play it and test it, long as you want, but to play seriously you will WANT to pay it.  O jogo é maravilhoso! Algo que eu tenho esperado por anos! Muitas classes e niveis! Você pode escolher as suas habilidades e seus pontos de atributos (como força e inteligencia) de uma forma que eu não via a muito tempo nos mmos. Ele é um mmorpg com detalhes antigos e novos ao mesmo tempo. Mas como é recente, e está na primeira semana de ascesso antecipado, ele tem alguns bugs e problemas de servidor. Além do que a IMC está tentando conter of bots e vededores de gold com algumas medidas não populares como por exemplo limitar a troca de itens. Mas eu realmente acho que dentro de algum tempo e com o suporte de quem acredita nesse jogo, ele vai se tornar um jogo grande, divertido e maravilhoso, em que a jornada para chegar ao final valerá tanto a pena quanto o endgame. Na minha opnião, anda bem dificil encontrar um novo jogo, mas esse é um bom jogo, que porém ainda está incompleto. Ele é gratis, mas para se aprofundar no jogo vc terá que pagar, não por ser pay to win (p2w), mas pelas mecanicas serem limitadas para quem não paga. Pessoalmente eu não ligo, visto que os melhores jogos atuais são pagos de qualquer forma, assim como WoW e FFXIV. Então é como se eles deixassem vc jogar e testar o quanto tempo vc quiser, mas para jogar sério vc vai acabar querendo pagar algo,

Among many thing that this game gets right, it's the ATMOSPHERE.  The art style blends in extremely well together. The character models, the background, the enemies, and even the UI. It just meshes together to really bring back a nostalgic feel that I feel a lot of old school MMO players would appreciate.  I also want to emphasize on another winning formula of this game; the music. Cerulean Wind, 3rd Wave, Due Solo. It's been a while since I played the beta, but I still remember the game themes clear as day.  If there's something they could have done more, is to provide a better information base within the game itself. While they've done an amazing job with this so far, there's still room for improvement.  - Show what upgrades do past not only the first level, in order to allow for better build planning. Sometimes, just increase in magic damage might not warrant the increased MP cost. - Include what stats do in the tutorials list, again, for better understanding of which stat to build from. No need for the standard MMO formula, just show that it 'increases max HP, increases HP regen' or whatever. Just basic text info. The formula should rightfully remain in the wiki for those who are curious even further. - The miscellaneous stats, like magic amplification and block rate, should also be explained like in the first point. - Include the name of the songs played while entering a new room at a corner somewhere on the screen. Will really help those who admire the music like me to get into the game more.

Note: This is a review based on a connection from east coast Australia on already shaky connections to servers.  TL:DR  There are issues with lag for me, that were made worse by shaky servers. Class balance was off, especially with classes that where objectively better than another. Mana and mana regen were really scarce, which makes class balance worse. It's a pretty looking and it sounds quite nice as well. I recommend if you don't get lag issues (or you can stand it).   After playing in the CTB2 beta, my opinion of this game was not very high. The majority of this is due to the bad connection between me and the server. The latency was so bad, that I could have been out of a boss's tell for .5seconds and still get hit by it. This is also exemplified by the fact you are stuck in auto attack animations that you fired off. So it could be that you fired an attack off, .1 of a second later a tell appears but .1 second after that you are then stuck in a attack that you can't move from leaving you stuck in an attack that you couldn't dodge. There may be ways of attack canceling but I didn't play around to find out.  Besides that; The art style for this game is greatly pleasing. It really is just nice to look at, and the majority of it is smoothly animated. The pieces that aren't as smoothly animated do tend to be a bit jarring but often it isn't completely over the top. This game is a good looker and I sure as hell didn't mind staring at it the entire time.  Gameplay wise, this game is good. Not spectacular though. Once again, the game has problems with latency (further made an issue with servers). Only your movement didn't seem affected by latency while attacks and skills are. This leads to a lot of jumps with the character as it has to correct it's position to where the attack/skill actually went off at.  Fighting was really satisfying, however mana and mana regen is extremely low in this game. This makes it so every character needs to rely on their auto attack between chugging mana potions. At the time of CTB2, the only truly viable solo character, once again especially with lag, was the swordsman. This was mainly because the swordsman (barbarian class) had a skill that could 3 shot quite a lot of bosses making the experience much much easier than any other class. That brings on the next issue, class balance at CTB2 was quite horrid in my opinion. I can't speak from mid-late game, but early game there are some really big balance issues, especially with the archer class not having any piercing benefits (even though they are piercing type). I'll leave it there before making a fool of myself though. Leveling is alright, although with plans to drop exp bonuses it might become quite grindy to level even early game. If you like that great, but if it's too slow to me after launch, I might as well play other games rather than grind. The best part is the classes in which it allows you to choose your own path and take skills that you want. You could say play a defensive archer and have that work etc etc. However as mention before class balance is off, and there were clearly better choices in classes you should pick at the time.  Storywise? Eh it was ok, nothing truly great, but enough to keep you going. Most quests however are not shown to the player. You actually needed to ask people, this is up to you whether or not you find it good. The bad part is, NPC's will not tell you if you are too low for a quest they have, meaning you could accidentally skip quests and end up behind the curve for levelling.  Soundwise, it was quite good. I've forgotten most of how it actually sounded, but if I remember correctly the music was a nice sub genre of electronic. One thing however. Sound was orientated depend on whatever direction your character was looking rather than the direction of the screen. A very awkward design choice there. (May not be the case for 2 channel audio)  Do I recommend this game? If it isn't laggy, go straight for it and see if you like the grind. If it is laggy, you may get frustrated like me and end up quitting because of the amount of BS that you couldn't control without going overly out of your way to correct.

Don't get me wrong, I've been following this game from the very start of its building process. Sadly, as we all feared, it has gone downhill somewhere in its release and partnerships with different companies along the way. Be it the cash shop system being extremely unfair towards other players, to the horrible performance and hacking issues... to the nearly unplayable lag rushes the game gets more often than it should, ToS turned out to be a lot of shattered hopes and dreams of an awesome re-enacting of what Ragnarok Online was, purely from things that should have been fixed along the way. Like with everything Korean-made that reaches our game markets, performance, balance and lag issues is a hit or miss; And for now it's a severe miss. Only time will tell if they manage to at least make it bearable.   Edit 7/21/2016:  After giving the game a serious investment, I have concluded that - while many if not all of the complaints I had to begin with remain there. - the artwork, music and customization of your character class do live up to what Ragnarok used to inspire. In fact, I can now affirmatively state it feels like an appropriate step up from it. What makes me change this review to a positive is one grand thing most MMOs as of late never, ever apply anymore; The game actually brings challenge to you without having to reach anywhere near the middle of the game. This actually makes someone like me, frustrated by the casualization and outburning of MMOs turning everything into a push to win simulator, actually have a blast having to use more than one neurone at a time.  All in all, if you are willing to go into this game knowing it is a gem mishandled by the publishers that will take a while to be properly polished, and keep yourself in the proper mindset for it - you will have fun.

To start don't let my hours fool the individuals who are reading this review. Everything about this game during the mid to late game is nothing but a way to force you to buy TP's. I had SO MUCH HOPE like a lot of other players but devs like these never fail to disappoint us players. I understand they need some kind of income but forcing us to buy TP at every corner is straight disrespectful. They have good artwork, music and the class system is one of the best i've seen but sadly that's all. So in conclusion i would not recommend this game because like me you will be highly disappointed.

I want it to be good. There are so many issues. It looks pretty, it feels fun sometimes. But too many times the cons are outweighing the pros.   EDIT: I'm going to change my recommendation to yes beacuse the devs are actively listening to the community and right now that gives me hope. Someone said something the other day stating this game has really only been out for only less than a month. That's significant! I'm going to say let's go for it and hope for the best. I'll continue to update.  EDIT 2: Playing the game involves grinding. You can't grind when hordes of bots steal the dwindling numbers of potential kills. The potential kills that don't respawn for minutes at a time. Take for example, my favorite - nonexistant - item in the game: The Panto Spearhead dropped by a Large Panto Spearman.  Know who has the largest number of kills of Large Panto Spearmen on Orsha? I do. Probably shy of 500 over a period of 8 days of farming upwards of 6-8 hours at a time. At first it was sickening, fighting hundreds of people to steal the kill over 8 channels. Then 8 channels became 6 channels. Then bots flooded back into the game and suddenly the potential kills are all gone. This is only Level 35 content here. Are you ♥♥♥♥ing kidding me? You think I'm going to forge ahead for the last 465 levels of torturous content? I enjoy a grind, hell yeah I played the living HELL out of RO but I don't enjoy this. Don't stop by. Don't waste your time. And good god when free to play opens up their already limited servers are going to ignite. I'll try again after the devs get their heads out of their asses and post a decent update.

So I played this game on the CBT and I can say for certain that this game is pretty good.  It has a lot of classes that you can play, making it a pretty versatile mmorpg (even though the classes don't have that much of skills to upgrade), and each class has a specific clothing that you can change back to, even when you upgrade to a new class, if you like the older one more. It has this aspect of customization that is pretty nice.   The crafting, gems and etc system can be a bit confusing at the beginning, but it is also easy to use. It is not a very complex system, so those that really like crafting systems will probably feel a bit disappointed here (I didn't, but I still have to say that because I know that some people are really into this kind of thing).  The spells system is pretty straightforward, although the classes that use too much mana may feel a bit overloaded by the enemies, since their mana will go too fast and they won't manage to beat the monsters by pure sheer force. Classes like the Cleric are actually good to play alone, because it won't spend that much mana, be tanky and still have a bit of strength so they can continuously attack the enemy.  The game is pretty good for beginners, overall, it will help you a lot and also feel pretty easy at the beginning. Although it will be a bit hard later. When you reach certain levels it becomes a huge problem to level up and you will need to grind. I really don't like this aspect of the game and think it is a cheap way to make it bigger, specially since, in this game, you'll reach huge levels like 200 level and more than that. You shouldn't need to spend a whole life only leveling one character, it is more fun to have a lot characters and if you want to level each one to the 'max', it will take a whole lot of time.  But, the game is fun. And also pretty. Since it is a F2P game, you can play it for a while and leave when you want to. So I can't not recommend it.
